title: Enlightenment: Reason and Natural Rights

vocab.definition: 18th century intellectual movement emphasizing reason and science
Rights believed to be inherent to all humans by nature
Agreement between people and government defining rights and duties
Division of government into legislative, executive, and judicial branches
French Enlightenment thinker who applied reason to social problems

teachingNotes: Connect Enlightenment ideas to American and French revolutions. Analyze how these concepts influenced modern democratic government.

sample.question: What 18th century movement emphasized reason and science?

truefalse.question: Natural rights are believed to be inherent to all humans.

multiplechoice.question: What divides government into three branches?

fillintheblank.question: An agreement between people and government is a ________ contract.

shortanswer.question: How did Enlightenment ideas influence the American Revolution?
